data.title: Kate Burton & John Caird on 'Love's Labour's Lost'
data.meta_description: Watch as actress Kate Burton interviews director John Caird (Les Misérables, Nicholas Nickleby) about his experience directing Love's Labour's Lost[/digitalstage/videos/the-stratford-festival-loves-labours-lost/] by William Shakespeare with The Stratford Festival, which is streaming as part our Digital Stage January 14 – April 14,...
data.text:
Watch as actress Kate Burton interviews director John Caird (Les Misérables, Nicholas Nickleby) about his experience directing Love's Labour's Lost by William Shakespeare with The Stratford Festival, which is streaming as part our Digital Stage January 14 – April 14, 2021.

About Love's Labour's Lost

Four young men swear off women to devote themselves to learning—only to fall for four attractive newcomers. Shakespeare's language reaches its most virtuosic heights in a vivacious comedy that will dazzle and delight.

About Stratford Festival

Located in Stratford, Ontario, Canada, the Stratford Festival is North America’s largest classical repertory theatre company. Each season, they present a dozen or more productions in four distinctive venues producing classics, contemporary dramas and musicals, with special emphasis on the plays of Shakespeare.
